body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install cmake@3.15.1
...
==> Fetching https://github.com/Kitware/CMake/releases/download/v3.15.1/cmake-3.15.1.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Error: ChecksumError: sha256 checksum failed for /tmp/bioinfo-cimr-worker-dir/workspace/bfx_spacktree_develop/spack/var/spack/stage/cmake-3.15.1-trzwd2ffmsdutngsfatb7atdjketg2o6/cmake-3.15.1.tar.gz
    Expected cdee72c5ef934c4972f1ad4e9c35712589345f3470a3cf15f7be493c170cc965 but got 18dec548d8f8b04d53c60f9cedcebaa6762f8425339d1e2c889c383d3ccdd7f7
```

### Additional information

The CMake repo has a SHA256 txt file that also says it should be `18dec548d8f8b04d53c60f9cedcebaa6762f8425339d1e2c889c383d3ccdd7f7`:
https://github.com/Kitware/CMake/releases/download/v3.15.1/cmake-3.15.1-SHA-256.txt
title: checksum error: cmake 3.15.1
